page.title: 14Education in Stevington
page.content: There are no schools in Stevington. Children are taken by bus to schools in adjoining villages.Twenty children aged five to nine years attend Rice Trevor Lower School in Bromham;fifteen chilldren aged nine years to thirteen years attend Lincroft Middle School and twenty-two children aged thirteen years to eighteen years attend Sharnbrook Upper School.Some thirty children attend private schools in Bedford where parents have to meet the cost of their education although some bursaries are available.Many go on to higher education at the age of eighteen.
